Other: The coordinator of Hofstra University‚Äôs institutional writing assessment, but I‚Äôll say it anyway: writing proficiency exams (WPEs) should be abolished. WPEs are often exit examinations in which a student must write a particular type of academic essay (argumentative, expository, etc) that demonstrates the base-level skills they are expected to know at that point in time. But what does proficiency look like? Hofstra‚Äôs official rubric lists four dimensions of grading criteria: thesis; evidence; citation; grammar.
